subclusters.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Conflict and Cellular Senescence Theory
Oxidative DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
Tumor Suppressor p53-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype and Inflammaging Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in autophagy causing accumulation of damaged organelles and proteins, leading to cellular senescence and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes tissue-specific decline in autophagic activity with age contributing to cellular senescence and organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details Rubicon-mediated suppression of autophagy as a conserved aging mechanism promoting senescence and age-related pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links DNA damage response and mitochondrial dysfunction to senescence and SASP, highlighting autophagy impairment in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses senolytic treatment effects and repair capacity impairment, implicating autophagy and senescent cell clearance in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Premature cellular senescence in brain linked to metabolic dysfunction and toxic secretome, implicating autophagy and senescence pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: PAI-1 regulates extracellular proteolysis affecting senescence and systemic aging, connected to cellular homeostasis and autophagy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Protease inhibitor-induced lamin A defects cause reversible senescence linked to impaired proteostasis and autophagy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Conflict and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes multicellularity contradiction model where unicellular autonomy conflicts with multicellular control, underlying senescence and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Conflict and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains cellular senescence as antagonistic pleiotropy balancing tumor suppression early in life and cancer promotion late in life.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Conflict and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Tumor suppressor activation prevents cancer but induces senescence and immune aging, illustrating evolutionary trade-offs.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Conflict and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: INK4-ARF locus tumor suppressor network restricts proliferation to prevent cancer but limits regeneration, contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Conflict and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: p53 integrates tumor suppression, IGF-1 signaling, and inflammation, with age-related decline affecting longevity and cancer risk.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Conflict and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: p53 activity balances tumor suppression and aging via feedback loops, exemplifying antagonistic pleiotropy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Conflict and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Genetic basis of cellular senescence as a dominant phenotype, supporting programmed senescence as an evolutionary mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Oxidative DNA damage accumulation triggers senescence via mitochondrial ROS, linking metabolic stress to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Oxidative DNA damage in vascular cells induces senescence and SASP, driving vascular aging and calcification in CKD.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p53-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: p53 regulates senescence and aging via isoform balance and interactions with ubiquitin ligases and nuclear bodies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: p16-RB signaling enforces senescence and limits proliferation, conserved across species as a fundamental aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: p16INK4a expression as biomarker of senescence and aging acceleration, especially after chemotherapy-induced stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Replicative senescence limits hematopoietic stem cell divisions via cell cycle checkpoints involving p16 and related pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proliferative lifespan checkpoints mediated by p53 and pRb pathways enforce senescence in a cell-type specific manner.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Telomere shortening triggers replicative senescence acting as tumor suppressor, linked to p16-RB and p53 pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Endothelial cell senescence mediated by p53/p21 and p16 pathways contributes to vascular aging and dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Defines senescence hallmarks including irreversible arrest and SASP, emphasizing p16 and p21 pathways in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescent cell accumulation and SASP effects, with focus on senolytic therapies targeting p16/p21 pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescent cell accumulation and SASP in skeletal muscle impair tissue function, linked to p16-RB mediated senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p16-RB Pathway Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescence in immune cells characterized by p16/p21 mediated arrest and SASP contributes to immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype and Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP-driven chronic inflammation (inflammaging) as a key driver of aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype and Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP and aberrant gene expression causing systemic inflammation and multi-system dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype and Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: SASP remodels tissue microenvironment, promotes secondary senescence, and drives systemic aging via inflammatory signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype and Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: p52-mediated signaling promotes SASP and paracrine senescence, amplifying inflammatory aging processes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tumor Suppressor p53-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: p53 activation in Brca1-deficient mice induces senescence causing premature aging and tumor suppression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype and Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescence-induced inflammation and NF-κB signaling drive epithelial plasticity and carcinogenesis via SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype and Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Accumulation of senescent T cells with SASP contributes to immune insufficiency and inflammaging.
